content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's an implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

You can test this function with the following code:
```julia
col = "My Column"
cleaned_col = clean_column(col)
println(cleaned_col)  # Output: my_column
```

This function takes a single argument `col` which is the name of the column to be cleaned, and returns the cleaned column name. The function first lowercases the column name using the `lowercase` function. It then removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Lastly, it replaces any
